results.title: The Tree outside my house
results.brief_description:
The concept of the project was to represent the process of establishing data. The data was established as a set of 20 facts about the tree outside my house. The representations of the processes were to be strongly associated with my memories of learning and using these processes.
Initially the concept of the project only dealt with the
visualisation of the height of the tree and the process to
establish that fact. The visualisation of this process was to
be based on my childhood memories of a school activity.
The initial concept was later widened to include 20 facts
about the tree.
I was more interested in the processes used to establish
the facts than the facts themselves. I wanted to explore my memories and visually represent the process as a memory. The processes I wanted to represent were tied to the following facts:
•The name of the tree
•The botanical name of the tree
•The distance from the tree
•The angle to the top of the tree
•The height equals distance multiplied by pi
•The height of the tree
•The width of the trunk
•The volume of the tree
•The age of the tree
•The colour of the bark in RGB
•The colour of the bark in hexadecimal
•The bark’s range and difference of colours
•The shape of the leaves
•The colour of the leaves
•The size of the leaves
•The area of the leaves
•The noise of the wind in the leaves of the tree
•The number of branches
•The location of the tree

results.title: The tree of truth
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
The story of a land with a magic tree that provides true or false answers to any problem posed. The king poses a question about wealth - experts disagree as to whether it is an addition or a sub-traction problem, although the tree maintains both methods are acceptable.
Previewing is essential. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Tree of life
results.creator_credit: Gerard De Boe, Harold Cooper and Lintas Film Unit
results.brief_description: The discovery, harvesting and preparation of palm oil in the Belgian Congo. Something of the history of the industry, the concession given to Lever Bros by King Leopold and the transportation difficulties in penetrating the interior of the Congo are shown.

results.title: The Tree house
results.brief_description: Asks if man can live in the world without oblierating its beauty. Shows how a bulldozer driver befriends a young boy who has built a treehouse on the edge of a site the man has to clear. Ends with the driver unable to tell the boy why his tree has to come down.

results.title: The Treatment of rape in a TV drama
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
Should a television producer show an incident of rape even though it may be disturbing and controversial? Would he regard it as an integral part of the play, or gratuitous titillation? Moderated by Mike Scott.

results.title: The Treasure hunt: teamwork
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
Presents a puppet show story about teamwork on a treasure hunt in order to show the value of working together to meet a common goal.

results.title: The Travelling tune: a musical phantasy in paper
results.brief_description: A round the world journey in which we see American jazz trumpeters, Venetian goldoliers, Mexican cowboys, Amerstdam canal-side houses, New York skyscrpaers and Bavarian beer mugs. All these scenes are created from colorful paper cutouts.

results.title: The Travel game
results.creator_credit: Tony Thompson, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: As the Hook Continental express leaves Liverpool Street Station, a passenger starts to guess where his fellow passengers are going. In his imagination the journey becomes interwoven with scenes of his travelling companions at their supposed destinations: among the windmills, diamonds and cheeses of Holland; at a Rhine wine festival; on Mount Pilatus in Switzerland; in Denmark and Germany.

results.title: The Trap
results.creator_credit: Alfred Socolow, Leo Trachtenberg and Harvest Films
results.brief_description: Interviews conducted with people who have been injured in the work place by ignoring safety procedures. In-depth accounts of the consequences of incidents that have left workers disabled and scarred by these traumatic events. Re-enactments of accidents that have occurred in the work place, reinforcing the practice of safety procedures.

results.title: The Training dividend
results.brief_description: Examines the need for industry and commerce to institute training programs to improve profitability, and discusses the various forms of assistance provided by the National Training Council.
